title: Simulation-Based Higher Education Operational Flexibility Design Process

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematical concepts and basic computer application skills
context.additional_context: Flexible Curriculum Design for Working Professionals and Improved Operational Efficiency Through Simulation-Based Training

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods to optimize curriculum scheduling and resource allocation using simulation tools
Learners can develop design proposals that improve operational flexibility indicators (e.g., bottleneck reduction rate, learner progress deviation) by 20%
Learners can interpret simulation results based on real-case data and apply them to curriculum operations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
